reviews.text: The rooms were fabulous!! The concierges were the best I have ever experienced. They booked side trips that were first class and the restaurants they recommeded were great. The location of the hotel was a few blocks from the heart of everything. We liked this because it was quiet and not many people around. The walk was a very easy walk to everything we wanted to see. It was very safe around our hotel for 2 women walking alone. Ate at the hotel for breakfast every morning and it was good. The service at the Excelsior was excellent!! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who travels frequently and expects the best. Will stay there again when in Florence.
reviews.title: Loved the Excelsior

reviews.text: The Westin is right off of the Arno River and a short walk from the heart of Florence. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. The room was great, but a bit old style as opposed to modern. They had a complimentary computer room and a very helpful concierge and staff. The only negative is that the breakfast was a total ripoff (20 Euros for some croissants & juice). We ate at Acqua al 2 (a restauarant on Acqua street - +39 55 28 4170 make reservations & try the tasting menus) which was one of the best restaurants I ate at in Italy (also try Il cantinone in Florence). Back to the hotel. It's in a great location in a great city. The rooms are very nice & it was a very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel is located right along the river and not too far from all the tourist attractions and the train station. The interior of the hotel is nice, clean and comfortable. The indoor gym exceeded my expectations. The concierge was friendly and provided excellent information and help.

reviews.text: Had a 2 night stay at The Westin Excelsior Florence. Liked the location and able to walk to all. We are Gold Starwood members.Upgraded to a very large room with a large outdoor patio/deck overlooking the Arno. This was really a treat for us. Able to sit outide and enjoy the views and relax after a triring day of walking the city.Very nice, comfortable room.Breakfast was costly 40+ Euro so we did the a la carte menu. We were not too hungry after the traditional late dinners. We LOVE our dinner at Profeta(recommended by Concierge) short walk from hotel. Highly recommened it. Great food and very friendly service.Although you can walk to everything it is a long walk back when you are hot and tired. We were there only two days so we did not figure out how to use their buses. Told that the small bus that passes the hotel only runs along the river. May want to check with staff about how to use public transportation or use Hop on Hop off bus? Helpful staff/conceirge. Was upset though. Left my diary of Italy trip in room. Despite my repeated efforts to have them check with housekeeping and the room, was never found. I suspect housekeeping threw it away. Would recommend a stay here, especially if you are a Starwood member and can use your points. Can contact with any questions.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the The Westin Excelsior, Florence for 3 nights in mid July, 2007. We booked a river view room with an additional room next door for our college aged daughter. Both rooms were clean and had comfortable beds and furniture. The river view was a bit disappointing. Small window, but OK as the river looked more like a sewage canal at that point in its travel.

reviews.text: Several months ago, we reserved two rooms (we had the kids), and they were supposed to be adjoining. When we discovered that the rooms were on two separate hallways on the same floor, we contacted the front desk. We were told that the rooms were actually very close to each other, and that those rooms were the only two available. (the rooms were not in sight of each other) After I said that I was still uncomfortable with the distance, another room was found a few doors away from the first. The solution was acceptable, but I felt that I had to be aggressive, and that bothered me. It makes me wonder why the second room wasn't offered immediately. We didn't ask for upgrades or anything out of the ordinary. The hotel rep was pleasant, and so was I, yet it leaves me feeling a little uncomfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 night during our honeymoon in September. I am a Starwood member so I received an upgrade upon my arrival. The room was huge - one of the biggest I have ever stayed in all of Europe. We were in room 430 and had a king sized bed, big bathroom and a balcony with views of the Arno and Ponte Vecchio. We got the honeymoon package which included breakfast in our room every day - a little annoying to have to schedule it every day so I would recommend going to the restuarant instead. The location was good - a little further away from the center of town which was good because it wasn't as loud and crowded. The staff was unbelievable - they shipped a bunch of our gifts we had purchase home (we received them all carefully wrapped and undamaged). They also arranged for an in-room massage in 40 minutes after the service wasn't offered anymore for the day. The hotel is wonderful but a little expensive considering some of the other values and great hotels in Italy.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel
Elegance on the Arno!
reviews.text: Stayed at the Westin Excelsior at the beginning of October. I am a Starwood member and they upgraded us to a large room overlooking the Arno and included a free bottle of wine. It was a wonderful room, very elegant. The concierge staff was very helpful with various questions prior to my arrival as well as restaurant reservations etc. Housekeeping was a bit sloppy considering it's a 5 star - left wet cleaning rags on the night stands, used floor mats on the chairs. Good location, a little bit of a walk to the center but not far. Fairly expensive - Should include breakfast at those prices. Overall a very nice hotel.
